example (h : (fun x => fderiv ‚Ñù f x 1) = (fun x => fderiv ‚Ñù g x 1))
    (hf : Differentiable ‚Ñù f) (hg : Differentiable ‚Ñù g): ‚àÉ (C : EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin 3)), (fun x => f x) = (fun x => g x + C) := by
  have h' : ‚àÄ (x : ‚Ñù), deriv (fun y => f y - g y) x = 0 := by
    intro x
    rw [deriv_sub]
    simp_all
    repeat fun_prop
  have hfg := is_const_of_deriv_eq_zero (Differentiable.sub hf hg) h'

    intro x y
    rw [‚Üê hfg x y]
    simp
  use (f 0 - g 0)
  funext x i
  rw [hfg' x 0]

I got a proof. Basically it uses the same idea. You may take a look if you really want to:

import Mathlib

open scoped Topology
open Real
open Filter

variable (f g : ‚Ñù ‚Üí EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin 3))

example
  (hf : Differentiable ‚Ñù f)
  (hg : Differentiable ‚Ñù g)
  (h : ‚àÄ x, fderiv ‚Ñù f x 1 = fderiv ‚Ñù g x 1) :
  ‚àÉ C, f = fun x ‚Ü¶ g x + C := by

  let diff := fun x ‚Ü¶ f x - g x

  have h_deriv_zero_at_1 : ‚àÄ x, fderiv ‚Ñù diff x 1 = 0 := by
    intro x
    rw [fderiv_sub (hf x) (hg x)]
    exact sub_eq_zero_of_eq (h x)

  have h_deriv_zero : ‚àÄ x, fderiv ‚Ñù diff x = 0 := by
    intro x
    apply ContinuousLinearMap.ext
    intro v
    obtain ‚ü®r, rfl‚ü© : ‚àÉ r : ‚Ñù, v = r ‚Ä¢ (1 : ‚Ñù) := ‚ü®v, by simp‚ü©
    calc
      (fderiv ‚Ñù diff x) (r ‚Ä¢ 1) = r ‚Ä¢ (fderiv ‚Ñù diff x) 1 := by simp
      _= r ‚Ä¢ 0 := by rw [h_deriv_zero_at_1]
      _= 0 := by simp

  let C := diff 0
  use C
  ext x i
  have diff_is_const := is_const_of_fderiv_eq_zero (hf.sub hg) h_deriv_zero
  have : f x = g x + C := by exact sub_eq_iff_eq_add'.mp (diff_is_const x 0)
  exact congrFun this i
This is longer than it needs to be because you're using is_const_of_fderiv_eq_zero and not is_const_of_deriv_eq_zero

example
    (hf : Differentiable ‚Ñù f)
    (hg : Differentiable ‚Ñù g)
    (h : ‚àÄ x, fderiv ‚Ñù f x 1 = fderiv ‚Ñù g x 1) :
    ‚àÉ C, f = fun x ‚Ü¶ g x + C := by
  use f 0 - g 0
  ext1 x
  rw [‚Üê sub_eq_iff_eq_add']
  refine is_const_of_deriv_eq_zero (hf.sub hg) ?_ x 0
